author: Dharma_Gardener
title: Make DApp for Worldwide Gardening!
description:
Climate has changed.

Biodiversity is suffering.

Topsoil reserves dwindling.

Poverty.

Humanity is out of sync with nature, spirit & self.

assessments.note: This proposal presents a unique viewpoint on the world, but it only vaguely identifies a problem related to growing the Cardano ecosystem in Africa.  This might work better in a different challenge.
This is an interesting idea. If it worked this would be an interesting way to get a large number of users of Cardano in Africa

All I get from the proposal is that somehow the DApp is supposed to support the great green wall by charging polluters and paying workers on the great green wall with it? Listen, I love the concept of the great green wall and I greatly appreciate the idea of supporting it, but since this proposal does not have a concrete plan on how it will be designed and how it is going to work, I can only give it 4 stars. In addition to this, judging from the comments you seem reluctant to onboard african devs, which is a bit disappointing, considering it would benefit people in africa even more and spread cardano there.

The idea is interesting, however, I thought the justification as to why it would be specifically beneficial for a little superficial Africa. I think the environmental issue is of interest to the whole world, so creating an application that seeks to guide people in the development of more ecological habits is valid. And in fact, using ADA in app payments would be beneficial for the Cardano project, now as Africa would be the protagonist in this, it all seemed a little vague. Note: 3.

The proposal is full of particularly good intentions, with an ambitious goal. However, besides these intentions we lack the minimum description of the solutions that would address a very widely described problem. We also must consider that climate change and environmental impact is not specific to Africa. I cannot see a wide impact on Africa for this project, because of the lack of details on the solution.

The proposer has a noble goal to help the Earth by making polluters pay others to garden through a DApp, but doesn't really describe how this would work; The proposal would benefit greatly if more details about the Dapp were provided. Without this information, the proposal does not effectively address the challenge.

I would like to see more detail about how the website and your proposal leads to the outcome you are looking to achieve.  I think that the proposal has some admirable goals, but the steps  between the funding and the goal are not clear to me. I wasn't able to view the website listed, so it was hard for me to assess relevant experience of the proposer.  The administrative costs seem high when compared to the amount needed for programs.

There is no real plan, currently its just an idea. More work needs to be done to flesh out exactly what needs to be built on both a technical and legal side. This who idea rests on finding people outside of africa who will pay people in africa to grow things. There is no plan on how to execute this side. The propoent shoudl find some people/entities to link up with to help on this side and present a plan linked with the experience to deliver it.

The author of the proposal does not reveal much about himself, only that he is based in Essex and Ontario. It is not clear what his exact background is, if he already has experience with application development, for example. It was important to know this information, so that there would be confidence in the future work. The author claims to be active and determined to help the community and nature, but does not point out how he does it. I believe that the attached website could clarify such issues, but unfortunately the link does not work. It is necessary to know a little more about the training and experience of the people who propose to carry out the projects at Cardano.

You seem like person experienced in a couple of fields, which indicates that you might have some versatility, skills and most importantly passion to bring into the project. However, the plan for this project is not very detailed and the budget is very high. If you demand this amount of money you should maybe have a very detailed, convincing proposal that has already planned all the single steps and considered all the things that need to be minded. And maybe also have some of the groundwork done in order to identify the problems and challenges better and have a better idea of the feasibility.

We almost have only a purpose to evaluate the feasibility, it's not enough. The App should be described with at least some details. The proposer mentions greatgreenwall.org, without making a link to the project. In the project milestones, the proposer expect to having hired the development team after 9 months, it seems far too long to me for a blockchain project : there is a good chance that another project fulfill this needs in a shorter time.

The proposer is asking for a budget of 150000, which seems very high for the described DApp. Most of the budget is allocated to the salaries of a few members of the team, and marketing, with only a small fraction allocated directly to development. There is also content that needs to be produced, but no budget is allocated for that. It would be useful if the proposer could identify project goals any possible roadblocks so it would be more apparent why certain roles are required (like an accountant)

This proposal is very holistic in nature and it seems like it may be difficult to gauge how effective it is in meeting the objectives.  I would like to see more detail on what success would look like and how the effect of the proposal could be measured.  I think that could be tricky with such a holistic proposal.
This idea needs more details and linked with people with experience before it can be deemed feasible.

The author provides information about how the project would be carried out according to the months, and also how the requested money would be divided. However, I thought that the amount requested was very high, the project is of potential, but in my opinion it would be safer to carry it out on a smaller scale and in case of success increase inventories.

The milestones and the aim are set very open-to-interpretation and a bit vague. Together with what the proposer added in the comments it gives a slight picture of what it could become, however I wish more effort was put into the proposal for something that has so much potential.

The proposer commits on providing evidence of the use of the fund toward the goal. However, measurement of the success is not defined, and the 4 milestones roadmap only contains very general statements. The proposers does not describes the target and the key figures that will enable the community to monitor the progress of the project.

The proposer lists serveral milestones over a years time, with only 3 months of that time dedicated to the development of the DApp. It would be helpful if the deliverables for each milestone were more detailed.

Healthy activities, sustainable jobs, earth renewal, etc
experience:
I've always been determined to help my community + nature.  
But I want to take these concepts, and so much more, to a larger audience. Online
